definition: to call/to cry/to shout/to breath out/to exhale

sentences.english: Everywhere they appeared they were ovations.
sentences.chinese: 他們所到之處都有人歡呼。

sentences.english: Also noisemakers are thought to be used at parties as a way of scaring away the evil spirits.
sentences.chinese: 而且，在生日會上發出的歡呼聲能夠嚇跑邪惡的幽靈。

sentences.english: The resolution was acclaimed with one voice.
sentences.chinese: 決議博得滿場異口同聲的歡呼。

sentences.english: Bill pitched so well that everyone cheered him.
sentences.chinese: 比爾球投得那麼好，大家都爲他歡呼。

sentences.english: Thunderous ovations were accorded the two leaders.
sentences.chinese: 這兩位領導受到雷鳴般的鼓掌歡呼。

sentences.english: The movie star was warmly cheered as he got on the stage.
sentences.chinese: 這位影星登上舞臺時受到人們的熱烈歡呼。

sentences.english: They noticed a crowd of people shouting and cheering.
sentences.chinese: 他們看到一大羣人在喊叫歡呼。

sentences.english: We oohed and aahed over our handiwork as the presents were exchanged.
sentences.chinese: 在交換禮物時爲對方親手做的小禮品不停地歡呼叫好。

sentences.english: Give a shout for Platty, Hughesy, Bouldy and Alex.
sentences.chinese: 爲普拉迪，曉仕，保迪和阿歷斯而歡呼吧。

sentences.english: The cheer of the fan echo round the grind as the team appear.
sentences.chinese: 球隊剛一上場，球迷的歡呼聲立即響遍全場。

sentences.english: Nu Wa side cheering them for a while, slowly got separated.
sentences.chinese: 他們在女媧身旁歡呼雀躍了一陣，慢慢走散了。

sentences.english: Miners knocking back middies in Port Hedland yesterday had reason to cheer.
sentences.chinese: 昨日在黑德蘭港痛飲的礦工們有理由歡呼。

sentences.english: But then the crowd began cheering and putting flowers into the gun barrels of the tanks.
sentences.chinese: 但是，很快人羣開始歡呼，紛紛把花插在炮筒裏。

sentences.english: Those in the orphanages needs cheerfulness.
sentences.chinese: 那些孤兒院需要歡呼聲。

sentences.english: It's the music of a people who are climbing to the light.
sentences.chinese: 那是一個民族歡呼，翻山越嶺見光芒。

definition: to inflate/to pump up/fig. to encourage/to boost morale
one after another/in succession/one by one/continuously/diverse/in profusion/numerous and confused/pell-mell
to be present/to be on the scene
to cry out in alarm or surprise
everyone present/the whole audience/across-the-board/unanimously/whole duration (of a competition or match)
to move emotionally/to stir up (emotions)/to excite
bean vermicelli/mung bean starch noodles/Chinese vermicelli/cellophane noodles/CL:把[ba3]/fan (loanword)/enthusiast for sb or sth
